# UIDynamicItem

**Protocol**

A set of methods that can make a custom object eligible to participate in UIKit Dynamics.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor protocol UIDynamicItem : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview

Starting in iOS 7, the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIView] and [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UICollectionViewLayoutAttributes] classes implement this protocol.

## Participating in dynamic animation

- **bounds**: Called when a dynamic animator needs the bounds of the dynamic item.
- **center**: The center point of the dynamic item.
- **transform**: The rotation of the dynamic item.
- **collisionBoundsType**: The type of collision bounds associated with the item.
- **collisionBoundingPath**: The path-based shape to use for the collision bounds.

## Constants

- **UIDynamicItemCollisionBoundsType**: Constants that indicate the shape of the item’s collision bounds.

## Dynamic Items

- **UIDynamicItemBehavior**: A base dynamic animation configuration for one or more dynamic items.
- **UIDynamicItemGroup**: A dynamic item that comprises multiple other dynamic items.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol

## Inherited By

- NSCollectionLayoutVisibleItem

## Conforming Types

- UIActivityIndicatorView
- UIAlertView
- UIBackgroundExtensionView
